m_DescList: URL, or Uniform Resource Locator, serves as an address to identify resources on the internet.
http://www.aspxfans.com:8080/news/index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name
From the URL above, a complete URL consists of the following parts:
1. Protocol: The protocol here is "http:", indicating the webpage uses HTTP. The "//" after "HTTP" acts as a separator.
Multiple protocols like HTTP, FTP, and HTTPS are valid.
<color=#3c3cff>http://</color><color=#666666>www.aspxfans.com:8080/news/index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name</color>
2. Domain: The domain is "www.aspxfans.com". An IP address can also be used as the domain.
<color=#666666>http://</color><color=#3c3cff>www.aspxfans.com</color><color=#666666>:8080/news/index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name</color>
3. Port: Following the domain, separated by ":". Port is optional; if omitted, the default port is used.
<color=#666666>http://www.aspxfans.com</color><color=#3c3cff>:8080</color><color=#666666>/news/index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name</color>
4. Virtual Directory: The part between the first "/" after the domain and the last "/". This is optional.
<color=#666666>http://www.aspxfans.com:8080</color><color=#3c3cff>/news/</color><color=#666666>index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name</color>
5. Filename: From the last "/" after the domain to "?" or "#". If no "?" or "#" exists, everything after the domain is the filename.
<color=#666666>http://www.aspxfans.com:8080/news/</color><color=#3c3cff>index.asp</color><color=#666666>?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#name</color>
6. Parameters: The part between "?" and "#". If "#" is absent, everything after "?" is parameters.
Multiple parameters are allowed, separated by "&".
<color=#666666>http://www.aspxfans.com:8080/news/index.asp?</color><color=#3c3cff>boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1</color><color=#666666>#name</color>
7. Anchor: The part starting from "#". This is optional; URLs are valid with or without it.
<color=#666666>http://www.aspxfans.com:8080/news/index.asp?boardID=5&ID=24618&page=1#</color><color=#3c3cff>name</color>
Now, construct a regex to match the part before parameters in a URL, excluding "?".
<color=#666666>The longer the description, the easier the challenge (scratch that)</color>
Rules for 100% of input data (simplified difficulty):
1. All input is lowercase; no mixed cases like "HTTPS"/"https".
2. Each input contains 0 or 1 matchable item.
3. If input is not a valid URL, output nothing.
